title: HOW TO BUILD THE ULTIMATE NO DIG GARDEN! (USING COVER CROPS AS A SHEET MULCH)

tasks.task: Preparing garden plot for no-dig farming using cover crops and mulch
subtasks: Lay down a silage tarp or greenhouse plastic across the garden plot
Wet the area under the tarp with sprinklers for an hour before covering to create steamy conditions
Tarp the plot for a minimum of 90 days or up to a year, depending on timing and climatic conditions
Remove tarp after sufficient time and address any remaining weeds
Broadcast a cover crop seed mix (e.g., winter rye, peas, oats) directly on the soil after tarp removal
Water the seeds if necessary and wait for natural germination and growth
Terminate the cover crop at the milk stage for winter rye or allow winter kill for peas and oats
Crimp the cover crop using a tool like a T-post and rope to flatten it and create a dense mat

tasks.task: Building garden beds using the sheet mulch from crimped cover crop
subtasks: Invert the crimped cover crop into the garden bed, ensuring roots are exposed
Add a 6-inch layer of manure-based compost over the sheet mulch
Install consistent-sized garden beds (e.g., 30 inches wide, 50 feet long) with 18-inch walkways
Mark garden beds with wood stakes and tomato twine for precise layout

tasks.task: Establishing walkways and additional garden features
subtasks: Apply wood chips to walkways for weed suppression and moisture retention
Direct-seed crops like winter squash in existing cover crop residue

tasks.task: Securing financial assistance for cover crop programs
subtasks: Utilize resources like FarmRays to manage farm finances and identify USDA grants
